content.value: A web page is a document delivered over the internet and rendered by a browser. It is usually written in HTML, styled with CSS, and can be made interactive with JavaScript.
A basic HTML page uses <!DOCTYPE html>, followed by <html>, <head>, and <body>. The head contains metadata; the body contains visible content.

content.value: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to control the visual presentation of HTML elements, including layout, colors, fonts, and spacing.
CSS selectors target elements (like p or .className), and rules apply properties such as color, margin, and font-size to those elements.
